The city of 'Bern' or 'Berne' (, ; ; ; ; Bernese German: BÃ¤rn ) is the
Bundesstadt (federal city, [[de facto]] capital) of Switzerland, and, with (as
of ) a population of , the fifth most populous city in
Switzerland. |publisher=Bern.ch |date= |accessdate=2011-09-15}} The
Bern agglomeration, which includes 43 municipalities, [http://www.bern.ch/l-
eben_in_bern/stadt/statistik/volkszaehlung/bevoelkerung/MM18200311.pdf Stadt
Bern : Medienmitteilung : 19 May 2003 : EidgenÃ¶ssische VolkszÃ¤hlung 2000: Neue
Definition der Agglomeration Bern (in [[German language|German]])] has a
population of 353,300. The metropolitan area had a population of
660,000 in 2000. Bern is also the capital of the Canton of Bern, the
second most populous of Switzerland's cantons.

The official language of Bern is German, but the main spoken language is the
Alemannic dialect called Bernese German.

In 1983 the historic old town in the centre of Bern became a UNESCO World
Heritage Site and Bern is ranked among the worldâs top ten cities for the best
quality of life (2010).
categories: Cultural property of national significance in the canton of Bern
